p:
In this model, λ m is the maximal instantaneous rate of death, X is the viral load or cytokine levels, and Xe( t) is the lag‐value of the viral load or cytokine, and X 50 value leading to 50% of the maximal hazard, and γ is a Hill coefficient. As hinted in the transversal analysis at D7, a model assuming the hazard function to be dependent on IFNα rather than viral load provided the best description of the time to death ( Figure
5 ), suggesting that cytokine storm, rather than viral replication per se, was the main driver of death.
